response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["age", "high", "At 20, younger individuals statistically tend to have a higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["gender", "medium", "Being male is associated with a moderately higher risk compared to females."],
    ["race", "medium", "Identifying as Black may intersect with systemic and socio-environmental factors that can elevate risk, though it is not determinative on its own."],
    ["arrest_history", "low", "A single arrest without conviction suggests limited criminal behavior history."],
    ["education", "low", "Having a high school diploma indicates basic educational attainment which is generally a protective factor."],
    ["marital_status", "medium", "Never having been married and living alone can imply reduced social support, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["employment_history", "low", "Holding three jobs during the year indicates some degree of employment stability and engagement."],
    ["substance_use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years is a significant protective factor."],
    ["mental_health", "low", "The absence of recent depression reduces one potential contributor to recidivism risk."],
    ["family_background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household with six members may expose one to environmental stressors that elevate risk moderately."],
    ["religiosity", "low", "Belief in God and considering divine influence can serve as a protective factor by providing a personal framework for positive behavior."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 20, younger individuals statistically tend to have a higher risk of recidivism.
Being male is associated with a moderately higher risk compared to females.
Identifying as Black may intersect with systemic and socio-environmental factors that can elevate risk, though it is not determinative on its own.
A single arrest without conviction suggests limited criminal behavior history.
Having a high school diploma indicates basic educational attainment which is generally a protective factor.
Never having been married and living alone can imply reduced social support, contributing moderately to risk.
Holding three jobs during the year indicates some degree of employment stability and engagement.
No drug use in the past four years is a significant protective factor.
The absence of recent depression reduces one potential contributor to recidivism risk.
Growing up in an urban household with six members may expose one to environmental stressors that elevate risk moderately.
Belief in God and considering divine influence can serve as a protective factor by providing a personal framework for positive behavior.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological dad in a household of size 6, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
